With reference to your letter No.5d76, dated the 22nd September 1934, I am directed to convey the following observations on the draft of the amending Regulation supplied by the Chairman, Aden Settlement. (a) The proposed amendment of Section 17(1) merely provides power to make bye-laws as to the grant of contributions to provident funds. Specific provision, it is considered, should be contained in the Regulation on the lines of Sections 3 and 9 for empowering the Executive Committee to create providient iunds and spend Aden Settlement Fund money for that purpose instead of leaving this power to be inferred from the fact that Section 17 gives power to make bye-laws regarding contri butions to such funds. (b) The words 'prescribed rates'* in the draft appear to refer to possible rules made under Section 13, although the expression is vague, and would in any case have to be altered to the formula contained in Sections 11 a( 2) and (3) and 12(2). ( c) A re-draft of the whole amending Regulation is enclosed. On comparing the wording of the proposed Section 9A in the re-iruft, with the wru wording of Sections 8 and 9 , it will be observed that the latter two sections contain no reference to rules. It is not improbable that the Chief Commissioner, might desire to make rules providing for powers to be exercised by the Executive Committee in respect of provident funds; but in case there is no such intention, or such a desire is not probable, the words 'rules or' might be omitted from Section 9A in the re-draft. < | (d)(d) Attention ia invited to the following point »hich emergea clearly from the re-draft. titleInfo.title: Coll 1/11 'Transfer of civil administration from Government of Bombay to Government of India; Aden Laws Regulation 1932'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 54; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional pagination sequence is present in parallel between ff 50-52.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the India Office Political Department, the Government of India Foreign and Political Department, the Secretary of State for India, and the Governor General of India in Council, regarding:the formal proclamation of Aden as a Chief Commissionership;the Ajmer Courts (Amendment) Regulation (1932);the Aden Law Regulation, No II (1932);and the Aden Settlement (Amendment) Regulation (1935).The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the end of the correspondence (folio one).
